abstract: Report by Comptroller Scott M Stringer warns that New York City's public hospital system will face deficit of more than $1 billion by 2017 should federal cuts take place as scheduled; government plans to cut subsidies to public hospitals based on theory that millions of people who are newly insured under Affordable Care Act will exert less pressure on system.
lead_paragraph: A report by Scott M. Stringer says the 11-hospital system expects to face a deficit of more than $1 billion in fiscal year 2017, which will grow in subsequent years.

headline.main: Federal Cuts Would Be Major Blow to New York City’s Public Hospitals, Comptroller Says
headline.print_headline: Report Says Federal Cuts Will Hurt Public Hospitals

snippet: A report by Scott M. Stringer says the 11-hospital system expects to face a deficit of more than $1 billion in fiscal year 2017, which will grow in subsequent years.

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject
